content.description: Features a roof, and then a dihedral. Tell your partner what you see through the window mid-way up.
content.location: On the non river side from "Fire in the Sky".

content.description: From the Ryan Hansen guidebook: "Follow the path of least resistance up the corner and upper face for the easier version, or take a more direct line for a 5.11 version."
content.location: Look for two anchor bolts at the top of the pinnacle with two pine trees at the base. Route is right of "Fire in the Sky".

content.description:
Mixed line for first 25 feet 

 Start on The Window crack for 20 feet then find a bolt with a good stance. Climb on perfect crimps and jugs for the rest of the climb. Finish climbing arete and clip into anchor. This route will be great once completely cleaned off

 Top out on the detached block above if your feeling adventurous
content.protection: 2 or 3 medium sized placements for the base, 5 bolts, 2-bolt anchors
content.location: This climb is located in between the Y-crack and Hell wall and is on the same side of the bluff. Start on the crack of The Window

content.description:
A long mixed trad route with good exposure once you break the tree line. Good climbing throughout, though the middle section is probably the highlight. The name stems from the sometimes fantastic afternoon light which can set the top of the spire ablaze in contrastÂ to the shade shrouded base.

 Start up a vertical finger crack system on the north part of the wall, just before the slabs. Once the crack ends move right to a water runnel and a #1 Cammalot placement. Move straight up to the bolt and climb the left side of the blunt arete for four bolts with the crux coming just after the second bolt. At the last bolt turn the corner to the right side, then climb steep jugs and hollow thin cracks to the top.
content.protection: A set of medium to large wires, and a single rack of cams from #.4 to #1. Four bolts mid route with chains at top. Best to belay from the top and then rap the route.

content.description: Part of The Pinnacle Wall per the 2006 Hansen guide, the Fire Spire is fairly conspicuous when approaching from the east side of the formation. It is a large golden wall with narrow summit and lone pinetree sticking out. The wall is North a bit of Mr. Canoehead.
